verses.t: Blessed{H835} is he whose transgression{H6588} is forgiven{H5375}, whose sin{H2401} is covered{H3680}.A Psalm…: or, A Psalm of David giving instruction
Blessed{H835} is the man{H120} Lordunto whom the {H3068} imputeth{H2803} not iniquity{H5771}, and in whose spirit{H7307} there is no guile{H7423}.
When I kept silence{H2790}, my bones{H6106} waxed old{H1086} through my roaring{H7581} all the day{H3117} long.
For day{H3119} and night{H3915} thy hand{H3027} was heavy{H3513} upon me: my moisture{H3955} is turned{H2015} into the drought{H2725} of summer{H7019}. Selah{H5542}.

I acknowledged{H3045} my sin{H2403} unto thee, and mine iniquity{H5771} have I not hid{H3680}. I said{H559}, I will confess{H3034} my transgressions{H6588} Lordunto the {H3068}; and thou forgavest{H5375} the iniquity{H5771} of my sin{H2403}. Selah{H5542}.

For this shall every one that is godly{H2623} pray{H6419} unto thee in a time{H6256} when thou mayest be found{H4672}: surely in the floods{H7858} of great{H7227} waters{H4325} they shall not come nigh{H5060} unto him.when…: Heb. of finding
Thou art my hiding place{H5643}; thou shalt preserve{H5341} me from trouble{H6862}; thou shalt compass{H5437} me about with songs{H7438} of deliverance{H6405}. Selah{H5542}.

I will instruct{H7919} thee and teach{H3384} thee in the way{H1870} which{H2098} thou shalt go{H3212}: I will guide{H3289} thee with mine eye{H5869}.guide…: Heb. counsel thee, mine eye shall be upon thee

Be ye not as the horse{H5483}, or as the mule{H6505}, which have no understanding{H995}: whose mouth{H5716} must be held{H1102} in with bit{H4964} and bridle{H7448}, lest{H1077} they come near{H7126} unto thee.
Many{H7227} sorrows{H4341} shall be to the wicked{H7563}: but he that trusteth{H982} Lordin the {H3068}, mercy{H2617} shall compass{H5437} him about.
Be glad{H8055} Lordin the {H3068}, and rejoice{H1523}, ye righteous{H6662}: and shout{H7442} for joy, all ye that are upright{H3477} in heart{H3820}.
